code: private String getFtpUrl() {     // uri encoded. This allows us to use the password 'as is' containing + & and other signs     return "ftp://joe@localhost:" + getPort() + "/upload?password=RAW(p+%w0&r)d)&binary=false". // END SNIPPET: e1 }

@Test public void testRawPassword() throws Exception {     sendFile(getFtpUrl(), "Hello World", "camel.txt").     File file = new File(FTP_ROOT_DIR + "/upload/camel.txt").     assertTrue("The uploaded file should exists", file.exists()).     assertEquals("Hello World", IOConverter.toString(file, null)). }
